_header: The unware woe that cometh on gladness
_description: The transitoriness of worldly prosperity — two stanzas rhyme royal

CamTCC599.First Lines:
The vnware woo that cometh in gladnesseys vnto hertys passyng
                    encomberousAnd who hath felte hys part of wylfulnesseSorow sewyng on
                    ys to hym odious…
CamTCC599.Last Lines:
…By wofull constreynt of long contynuaunceBettyr ys to dy then
                    lyue in suche penaunce

         Norman, OK: Pilgrim, 1987.
